channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: This is a 1/2 mile stretch where the road (as such as it is) is completely disintegrated., 8th August
item.description:
The road section has got progressively worse since the Spring but is a major cyclists route and as such is very dangerous. The whole route from Withington is deplorable and needs urgent attention
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withington, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foliage covering pavement, 8th August
item.description:
Hello Can someone please trim the trees bushes along the footpath by the river Chelt along honeybourne way. The footpath is almost obstructed in parts. Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate on cycle route impassable on a cycle, 8th August
item.description:
This is a clearly signposted shared footpath & cycle route, but for some reason the fence & gate has been rebuilt here in the last week in a way that makes it impossible to cycle through. You have to dismount, and with heavy panier bags or a child seat on the bike this is nigh on impossible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SWINDON VILLAGE sign at edge of village missing, 7th August
item.description:
This has been missing since at least December 2022. If removed for refurbishment, when will it be replaced? If stolen why has it not been identified as missing during regular and frequent highway inspection and replaced?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-13, River Leys, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees force people into the road, I am visually impaired and this is potentially dangerous, 7th August
item.description:
The trees are too overgrown, half the pavement is lost to the trees
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Convex mirror broken - needs replacing, 7th August
item.description:
Can’t get out the Naunton Park Rd, Naunton Lane junction safely as mo convex mirror in use. Damaged by a big vehicle mist likely Please replace urgently before a collision occurs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Naunton Park Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barnwood Road by Aldi, 6th August
item.description:
There has been many patches of road by Aldi, which just keep breaking up. Can you look to do a proper repair and not just a patch job, as it is just a waist of time and resources to not do a proper job.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The 3 marker indicator come off sign, 6th August
item.description:
The marker as you come off at 11a where it goes ||| || |, the 3 one has come of the post.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes junction Elmfield Ave and Midwinter Ave, 6th August
item.description:
Potholes getting worse have been here weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Midwinter Avenue, St Peter's, Cheltenham

item.title: Red Light Bulk gone, 6th August
item.description:
On traffic signal number 8 the red light bulb is broken. Junction of Delta Way and Hucclecote Rd heading towards Hucclecote from Brockworth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Traffic light failed, 6th August
item.description:
Red traffic light failed no7 ?, Junction Nine Elms Road and Cheltenham Road, Longlevens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Rubbish and flytipping, 6th August
item.description:
Rubbish and old toy cart dumped in hedge

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harry Yates Way, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing beeping, where there is more than one crossing., 5th August
item.description:
There are two crossings in very close proximity to each other (Millbrook St and Gloucester Rd, opposite Arle Rd), because the crossings are so close this can cause confusion regarding which crossing has turned green. This creates a potentially fatal situation for a blind person, tactile paving and rotating cones under push button boxes should be used instead as per RNIB guidance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-30, Millbrook Street, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken park equipment, 5th August
item.description:
Is there any chance this bird rocker could be fixed or replaced in the park please? Children fall off it as soon as they sit on it. It goes to far to the side and almost touches the floor. It seems like the balance has gone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newdawn Place, Arle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Just fill the hole in I'm begging you, 5th August
item.description:
The barrier is blocking the pavement again. I moved it out of the way to help someone on a mobility scooter to get round it. I think it's a year old now. Fix it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Hales Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 5th August
item.description:
Large rectangle patch of road has broken down on middle lane just before jct 11a southbound. Deep enough to cause damage and people moving over to avoid are hazard to inside lane. Has been there for months and getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10 inch pot hole and quite deep, 5th August
item.description:
Pot hole has been here for several weeks. It is situated in on the right hand side of the road outside 35 MILLHAM ROAD
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millham Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Fly tipping on soft verge of road, 4th August
item.description:
There is what looks like two domestic “white goods” type appliances that have been fly tipped on the soft verge of the carriageway coming down the old Birdlip Hill just by the turning into Great Witcombe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped Electrical Equipment, 4th August
item.description:
Near a bus stop on eastbound (north) side of Lansdown Rd, by entrance to Bleasby Gardens. Thanks for sorting this out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Lansdown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Series of potholes in road., 3rd August
item.description:
There are a number of potholes on this road around this point, both in the centre and in the direct line of tyres, likely to cause damage to vehicles on this busy stretch.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
